alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 06 at 11:25AM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Utah... The Lower Weber River At Plain City affecting Northern Wasatch Front zone. .Recent warm temperatures have contributed to continued high river flows due to snowmelt. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Near minor flooding is forecast. Increased flow greater than the forecast will result in minor flooding. * WHERE...The Lower Weber River At Plain City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet (4590 cfs), flooding will occur along the levee system near Plain City, affecting local farmland adjacent to the Weber River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 24.6 feet (3668 cfs). - Forecast...Flows will remain near or above action stage through the upcoming week. The current peak forecast is 25.4ft (3963 cfs) during the afternoon of Saturday, May 13. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet (4590 cfs). - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
